edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.scene.tangible
Class NeuronMorphology

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.scene.tangible.Tangible
          edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.scene.tangible.NeuronMorphology
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISelectable, ISemanticsAware
Direct Known Subclasses:
MorphMLNeuronMorphology, NeurolucidaNeuronMorphology
public abstract class NeuronMorphology
extends Tangible

Describes the morphology of the cell, independent of different ways of visualizing it. Since it is a three-dimensional morphology, this will describe points in a local 3D space.

Author:
Stephen D. Larson (slarson@ncmir.ucsd.edu)

public boolean isFreeFloating()
Tells whether this cell is attached to a parent curve

Returns:
True if this cell has NO parent curve

move

public void move(float dx,
                 float dy,
                 OMTVector constraint)
Overrides the general Tangible move() because most cells will be attached to a curve therefore, in most cases cells only move along a curve's time

Overrides:
move in class Tangible
constraint - Specifies what dimensions to allow movement based on mouse input. Will typically range from (0,0,0) to (1,1,1). Where (1,1,0) corresponds to 2D movement on the current X,Y plane

positionAlongCurve

public boolean positionAlongCurve(Curve3D c,
                                  float time)
Set the position of this NeuronMorphology at point time along curve c, or does nothing if it is a free-floating neuron

Parameters:
c - The curve to position this neuron along
time - The time to place it along the curve from [0,1]
Returns:
True if moved successfully, returns false if it does not move (free-floating neurons)
